result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin C. Woodrich

records.addlTxt:
11:43 AM Cases 21CF259 and 22CF30 called together. Defendant Justin C. Woodrich in court. Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Justin C. Woodrich. Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Cases are on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing. Agreement is recited by Attorney Pollak: def pleading to felony bond jump in 4 and 5 of 21CF259, joint rec for 2 yrs probation and withheld sentence. Court asks def if they understand the agreement. Def does. Court reviews Def's constitutional rights. Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties. Def understands. Court asks for pleas. Def enters pleas of Guilty. Court finds def is making pleas knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily. Court finds a factual basis to accept the pleas.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 4 and 5 of 21CF259 and orders a JOC; remaining counts and 22CF30 are DRI. DA asks Court to accept agreement. Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement, 39 days jail credit (stipulated). Def makes a statement to the Court.  Court takes judicial notice of Eau Claire County case 19CF1724.
Court orders:
21CF259, Count 4- $250 DNA; 52 days jail (time served, with 39 days jail credit and good time) concurrent to Count 5
21CF259, Count 5- $250 DNA; 52 days jail (time served, with 39 days jail credit and good time) concurrent to Count 4
Bond to apply.
Defendant shall not use or possess firearms for life. Defendant shall not vote in any election until their civil rights are restored. 
Appeal rights provided. DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.

ADDRESS INFO for Justin C. Woodrich
Current: PO Box 1195, Chewelah, WA 99109 United States  (Effective: 09-30-2022)
Prior: 11703 M Y Rd, Frederic, WI 54837
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 3, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:37 PM Cases 21CF259 and 22CF30 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin C. Woodrich appeared by video.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Justin C. Woodrich. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: offer discussed, needs plea/sentencing.  Resolution is for pleas to possession of methamphetamine and felony bail jumping; 3 yrs probation.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on July 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:11 PM 21CF259 and 22CF30 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin C. Woodrich appeared by video.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Justin C. Woodrich. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: negotiations actively continue.
Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on June 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:48 AM Cases 21CF259 and 22CF30 called together.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin C. Woodrich appeared by phone.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Justin C. Woodrich. Case on for Status Conference.  Court addresses the fact that the def doesn't appear in person.  Atty Gabriel responds, updates the Court: cases are not yet resolved, requests trial date.
Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:56 AM Cases 21CF259 and 22CF30 called together.  Defendant, Justin C. Woodrich, appeared with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Def appears telephonically.  Cases on for status conferences.  Atty Pollak updates- preparing counter offer, requesting 1 additional status conference.  Def makes statement.  Court requires in person appearance from this defendant for every hearing from now on.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on May 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:48 AM Cases 21CF259 and 22CF30 called together.  Defendant, Justin C. Woodrich, appeared with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Case 22CF30 on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Arraignment on March 14, 2022 at 11:45 am.

03:00 PM Cases 22CF30 and 21CF259 called together.  Defendant, Justin C. Woodrich, appeared with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Justin C. Woodrich appeared by phone means with Attorney by video.  Case 22CF30 set for prelim, will be a waiver of preliminary hearing.  Case 21CF259 on for status conference.  Case 22CF20 proceeds to Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information mirroring complaint.  Separate arraignment requested.  If next hearing will be a plea, parties to update court as soon as possible.  Arraignment scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 11:45 am.
State's Discovery Demand
Same conditions as previous bonds.

01:10 PM Cases 21CF259 and 22CF30 called together.  Defendant Justin C. Woodrich in court with attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Defendant in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Case 22CF30 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG pleas entered to misdemeanors.  Atty Pollak wishes to proceed on BM hearing before deciding on time limits.  Case 21CF259 on for motion hearing on defense's suppression motion.  State calls first witness, Deputy Bailey Mangen, who is sworn in and testifies.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  State rests.  Atty Pollak crosses.  State objects- relevance; Atty Pollak argues, overruled.  State rests.  No further witnesses called.  State argues against suppression motion.  Atty Pollak argues in favor of the suppression motion.  State enters rebuttal.  Court rules in favor of the State, denies the suppression motion.  Cases proceed to bond modification hearing.  Atty Pollak argues to lower bond.  State argues against bond motion.  Court amends bond to $500 cash with current conditions.  Status conference scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on February 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant must post $750 cash bond to cover Burnett County cases 21CF259 and new allegations filed in 22GF33 to be released from custody.  No use or possession of any alcohol, illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion. Defendant shall maintain gainful employment.  No contact with victim in Eau Claire County cases "A.A." or her children outside of any other court order.
